alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 07 at 12:52PM MST until August 07 at 3:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northeastern Cochise County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 345 PM MST. * At 1251 PM MST, an area of dust was along a line extending from near Bowie to 6 miles west of Steins, moving northeast at 10 mph. Additional storms will be moving across this area through 345 pm. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with * This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 358 and 390. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with Locations impacted include... Bowie and San Simon. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
